articles.title: Budget’s housing promises not enough to solve affordability, supply issues: advocates
articles.description: Housing advocates are lamenting “missed opportunities” in last week’s federal budget, saying more effort will be needed to accelerate home construction and bring prices down. The Liberal government’s 2025 budget tabled Nov. 4 — its first under Prime Minister Mark Carney — ple

articles.title: Your anxiety may be controlled by hidden immune cells in the brain
articles.description: Researchers have uncovered surprising evidence that anxiety may be controlled not by neurons but by two dueling groups of immune cells inside the brain. These microglia act like biological pedals—one pushing anxiety forward and the other holding it back.

articles.title: French relief as Algeria frees jailed novelist at centre of diplomatic crisis
articles.description: Almost a year to the day after Boualem Sansal was arrested, the Algerian president grants him a pardon.

articles.title: New Neanderthal footprints in Portugal reveal a life we never expected
articles.description: Footprints preserved on ancient dunes show Neanderthals actively navigating, hunting, and living along Portugal’s coastline. Their behavior and diet suggest a far more adaptable and socially complex population than once assumed.

articles.title: France marks 10 years since Paris’ deadliest peacetime attacks in silence and ceremony
articles.description: Sophie Dias fought back tears outside the Stade de France Thursday as she described living with what she called “a void that never closes” since the night her father became the first person killed in France’s deadliest peacetime attack, a night that still scars Paris and shapes the country 10 years

articles.title: 10 years after Bataclan massacre, Paris is still scarred by Islamic State attacks
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Sophie Dias fought tears outside the Stade de France on Thursday as she described her “void that never closes” since her father became the first person killed in France’s deadliest peacetime attack — a night of terrorism a decade ago that still scars Paris and shapes the country.

articles.title: Montreal restaurants hit with barrage of fake Google reviews in extortion scam
articles.description: Many of the bogus reviews were posted under the names of English cricket stars.

articles.title: Jupiter’s wild youth may have reshaped the entire Solar System
articles.description: Simulations reveal that Jupiter’s rapid growth disrupted the early solar system, creating rings where new planetesimals formed much later than expected. These late-forming bodies match the ages and chemistry of chondrite meteorites found on Earth. The findings also help explain why Earth and the oth

articles.title: ‘Utter hypocrisy’: tobacco firm lobbied against rules in Africa that are law in UK
articles.description: British American Tobacco pushed Zambian ministers to drop or delay ad bans, health warnings and restrictions on flavoured products, letter showsBritish American Tobacco has been accused of “utter hypocrisy” for lobbying against tobacco control measures in Africa that are already in place in the UK.A

articles.title: Edmonton Oilers scratch out a two-game win streak with consecutive OT winners: Cult of Hockey Player Grades
articles.description: The Edmonton Oilers were the better team over sixty-plus minutes but still had to squeak out a 2-1 Overtime victory Wednesday in Philadelphia. The Oilers dominated over forty minutes. The shots were 13-5 in the first, with no Philadelphia shots over the final eight. In fact, Edmonton had 14 in a row
